articles.title: Michelle Yeoh is first Asian best actress Oscar winner
articles.description: Superstar Michelle Yeoh of "Everything Everywhere All at Once" scored an Oscar on her first nomination, becoming the first Asian lead actress to win.
articles.content:
International icon Michelle Yeoh made history Sunday by winning the Oscar for lead actress, the first Asian ever to triumph in the category.
“For all the little boys and girls who look like me watching tonight, this is a beacon of hope and possibilit... [2686 chars]

articles.title: A$AP Rocky cheers on pregnant Rihanna at 2023 Oscars
articles.description: A$AP Rocky continues to be Rihanna’s No. 1 fan as the rapper was seen cheering for the pregnant pop star from the audience at the 2023 Oscars Sunday.

articles.title: Sudden unexpected infant deaths surged among Black babies in 2020
articles.description: Each year, thousands of babies die suddenly and unexpectedly, and more than 3,300 young lives were lost in 2020. Rates remained stubbornly high in the first year of the Covid-19 pandemic, even as overall infant mortality dropped to a record low.
articles.content:
CNN —
Each year, thousands of babies die suddenly and unexpectedly, and more than 3,300 young lives were lost in 2020. Rates remained stubbornly high in the first year of the Covid-19 pandemic, even as overall infant mortality dropped to a record low... [7281 chars]

articles.title: Michelle Yeoh makes history with best actress win at 2023 Oscars
articles.description: Michelle Yeoh heads into Oscars Sunday as the first best actress nominee to openly identify as Asian.
articles.content:
Much like her 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' character, Michelle Yeoh has become an unstoppable force.
LOS ANGELES -- Michelle Yeoh won the Academy Award for best actress Sunday night and made history all at once.
The Malaysian-born actor became... [2838 chars]

articles.title: Crypto Market Rallies on FDIC Banking Intervention, USDC Regains Dollar Peg
articles.description: The whole crypto market rallied on Sunday evening on news of government intervention in a banking crisis. USDC regained its peg.
articles.content:
The market cap of all cryptocurrencies is back above the $1 trillion mark.
After a joint statement from the Federal Reserve, U.S. Treasury, and FDIC declared that all depositors of now-shuttered Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank will be able to ... [2252 chars]

articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank clients to get deposits back, feds say
articles.description: Top officials at federal agencies assure customers of failed Silicon Valley Bank that they'll be fully protected, and add that taxpayers will not bear the costs.
articles.content: The U.S. government took extraordinary steps Sunday to stop a potential banking crisis after the historic failure of Silicon Valley Bank, assuring those who had made deposits at the failed financial institution that they would be able to access all o... [6104 chars]

articles.title: Risky Bet on Crypto and a Run on Deposits Tank Signature Bank
articles.description: Regulators said keeping open the 24-year-old institution, which held deposits from law firms and real estate companies, could threaten the financial system’s stability.
articles.content: Signature Bank, a New York financial institution with a big real estate lending business that had recently made a play to win cryptocurrency deposits, closed its doors abruptly on Sunday, after regulators said that keeping the bank open could threate... [1279 chars]

articles.title: Biden will announce sweeping protections preventing new Arctic drilling ahead of Willow decision
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Monday is expected to announce sweeping new protections for federal lands and waters in Alaska, according to an administration official, as the administration is poised to soon approve a major oil drilling project in the state.
articles.content:

articles.title: Ke Huy Quan tears up during Oscar acceptance speech
articles.description: Ke Huy Quan won the award for supporting actor, his first, for his role in 'Everything Everywhere All at Once.'
articles.content:
Visibly stunned and weeping, Ke Huy Quan took the Dolby Theatre stage to accept the supporting actor award for his role in “Everything Everywhere All at Once.”
Quan, 51, is the second Asian actor to win in the category; the first was Cambodian Americ... [1516 chars]

articles.title: US-S Korea drills begin after N Korea submarine missile test
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — The South Korean and U.S. militaries launched their biggest joint military exercises in years Monday, as North Korea said it conducted submarine-launched cruise missile tests in apparent protest of the drills it views as an invasion rehearsal.
articles.content: This photo provided by the North Korean government shows what it says is a cruise missile the country test-fired from a submarine off the east coast of North Korea early Sunday, March 12, 2023. Independent journalists were not given access to cover t... [7373 chars]
